definitions.definition: a small amount or a piece of something, especially food

examples.text: He ate it all, down to the last morsel.
a few tiny morsels of bread
She couldn't eat even a morsel of the beef that he had ordered.
They put out some tasty morsels for the hedgehogs.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, diminutive of mors ‘a bite’, from Latin mors- ‘bitten’, from the verb mordere.
